verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.comment: Maintains direct address from God to Moses.

verses.text: Speak to Aaron and say to him, 'When you set up the lamps, the seven lamps shall give light in front of the lampstand.'
verses.comment: The lampstand (menorah) is referenced here as in Exodus.

verses.text: And Aaron did so; he set up the lamps to face toward the front of the lampstand, just as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.comment: Aaron obeys as instructed; mirrors original Hebrew phrasing.

verses.text: Now this was the work of the lampstand: hammered gold from its base to its flowers. According to the pattern the LORD had shown Moses, so he made the lampstand.
verses.comment: Emphasizes craftsmanship and adherence to God’s revealed design.

verses.text: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.comment: Repeats divine speech formula for a new section.

verses.text: Take the Levites from among the people of Israel and cleanse them.
verses.comment: Clear command for Levite purification.

verses.text: This is what you shall do to them to cleanse them: Sprinkle the water of purification on them, and let them shave their whole body and wash their clothes and so purify themselves.
verses.comment: Translation maintains details about ritual cleansing.

verses.text: Then let them take a young bull and its grain offering of fine flour mixed with oil, and you shall take another young bull for a sin offering.
verses.comment: Offerings specified for Levite dedication.

verses.text: And you shall bring the Levites before the tent of meeting and assemble the entire congregation of the people of Israel.
verses.comment: Highlights public nature of the consecration.

verses.text: When you bring the Levites before the LORD, the people of Israel shall lay their hands on the Levites.
verses.comment: Imparts symbolism of identification and blessing.

verses.text: And Aaron shall offer the Levites before the LORD as a wave offering from the people of Israel, that they may perform the service of the LORD.
verses.comment: Wave offering means presentation before God; adapts 'wave' for modern comprehension.

verses.text: Then the Levites shall lay their hands on the heads of the bulls, and offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering to the LORD, to make atonement for the Levites.
verses.comment: Notes distinction between sin and burnt offerings.

verses.text: And you shall set the Levites before Aaron and his sons, and offer them as a wave offering to the LORD.
verses.comment: Repeats wave offering phrase for emphasis.

verses.text: Thus you shall separate the Levites from the people of Israel, and the Levites shall be mine.
verses.comment: Emphasizes Levites’ unique dedication to God.

verses.text: After that, the Levites shall go in to serve at the tent of meeting, when you have cleansed them and offered them as a wave offering.
verses.comment: 'Go in to serve' is literal rendering of the Hebrew.

verses.text: For they are wholly given to me from among the people of Israel; instead of all who open the womb, the firstborn of all the people of Israel, I have taken them for myself.
verses.comment: Phrase 'wholly given' captures Hebrew idiom 'in place of the firstborn.'

verses.text: For all the firstborn among the people of Israel, both man and beast, are mine; on the day that I struck down all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, I consecrated them for myself.
verses.comment: Direct reference to the Exodus events.

verses.text: And I have taken the Levites instead of all the firstborn among the people of Israel.
verses.comment: Summarizes substitutionary principle.

verses.text: And I have given the Levites as a gift to Aaron and his sons from among the people of Israel, to do the service for the people of Israel at the tent of meeting and to make atonement for the people of Israel, so that there may be no plague among the people of Israel when the people of Israel come near the sanctuary.
verses.comment: Expands on Levite responsibilities as mediators.

verses.text: So Moses and Aaron and all the congregation of the people of Israel did so to the Levites; according to all that the LORD commanded Moses concerning the Levites, the people of Israel did to them.
verses.comment: Threefold repetition matches original for emphasis.

verses.text: And the Levites purified themselves and washed their clothes; and Aaron offered them as a wave offering before the LORD, and made atonement for them to cleanse them.
verses.comment: Summarizes cleansing and ritual actions; preserves original sequence.

verses.text: After that, the Levites went in to do their service at the tent of meeting before Aaron and his sons. As the LORD had commanded Moses concerning the Levites, so they did to them.
verses.comment: End of ritual; reference to obedience and fulfillment.

verses.text: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.comment: Section break; divine speech form.

verses.text: This is what applies to the Levites: from twenty-five years old and upward they shall come to take part in the work of the tent of meeting.
verses.comment: 25 years old differs from Num. 4:3 (30 years); possibly a training period.

verses.text: And from the age of fifty years they shall retire from service in the work and shall not serve any more.
verses.comment: Describes age of retirement for Levites; matches Hebrew meaning.

verses.text: They may assist their brothers in performing their duties at the tent of meeting, but they shall not carry out the work themselves. Thus you shall do for the Levites concerning their duties.
verses.comment: Retired Levites may assist but not bear burdens; clear and literal rendering.
